Laura Bowne Whitman and Thomas Curtis Danziger were married yesterday. Justice Harold Tompkins of State Supreme Court in Manhattan officiated at the Creek Club in Locust Valley, N.Y.

Ms. Whitman, who is 33 and is keeping her name, is a vice president of Christie's, the auction house in New York. She conducts appraisals and assembles auctions of Chinese paintings. The bride graduated from Williams College and received a master's degree in East Asian studies from Yale University.

She is the daughter of Barbara and William F. Whitman Jr. of Bluffton, S.C. Her father is the chairman of the Middleby Corporation in Rolling Meadows, Ill., which designs and makes cooking equipment for restaurants.

Mr. Danziger, 40, is a partner in Danziger & Danziger, a New York law firm, which specializes in art and intellectual property law. He graduated with honors from Wesleyan University and received a law degree from New York University.

The bridegroom is a son of Dr. Marlies K. Danziger of Scarsdale, N.Y., and the late Erwin Danziger. The bridegroom's mother retired as a professor of English at Hunter College and at the City University of New York Graduate Center. She is now an editor for the Yale edition of the private papers of James Boswell. The bridegroom's father was a business manager in the New York offices of Spiegel Inc., the catalog company.
